There was no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms, there is free tea and coffee facilities in the lobby but these were constantly running out. The hotel is right on the edge of the Tenderloin area but we felt quite safe as long as we went towards the downtown area. The hotel makes a big deal about a secret password on its facebook page saying you would get special treats for using the secret password. You dont, you just get wi-fi which everyone seems to get anyway.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ACK_11
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at the Serrano for 4 nights and had a very nice time. Our room was very quiet and comfortable given that it was the room directly off the elevators. The bed was very comfortable and the room was cheery. The location of the hotel is excellent too. We popped in to the hotel restaurant, Jasper's one night for a late night appetizer but the service was extremely slow. The staff were very nice but we were there for well over an hour and all we ordered were sliders (at least they were tasty!)...All in all, it was a pleasant experience and we would stay there again. The staff were all very curtious and helpful as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulRainforest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nites in July. Very comfortable, clean and well appointed rooms. Lobby is very nice. Coffee in am is excellent, and complimentary cocktails in late afternoon in lobby are fun and provides opportunity to meet other travellers. Gym is not huge but decent with good equipment and enough space for a good workout. Good central location - close to great shopping at Union Square and lots of restaurants nearby. This is our second stay in a Kimpton and we have been very pleased both times. You won't go wrong booking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smallish but okay”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper155004
Reviews.Content: I had recently stayed at the sister hotel next door and found it to be far superior. The Serrano is tired and in need of a facelift. The rooms are small, albeit clean. If you need to put out your toiletries, don't bring many because the bathroom has no vanity. If you are looking for a cost efficent place to stay, then you may be happy here. The area is close to the Tenderloin district however so are a lot of other hotels so don't be discouraged by that. Staff was courteous. Rooms clean. Service good. Breakfast mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chooseytraveler12
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby with so much character! Staff was attentive and welcoming. Complimentary evening summer sangria was fabulous. Rooms are clean and quiet. It is a charming hotel with great linens,towels, and spa toiletries. I loved my fluffy robe provided in the closet. It is very old and the rooms are small that however would not prevent me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not good enough for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: olgashis
Reviews.Content: I bought the Serrano room based on the beautiful pictures (I love all French) posted on different websites. I paid $200 a night but was quite disappointed upon arrival. I would not pay more than $120 for such room: the wall paper in the bathroom has started to peel off, the carpet in the room is fading out and the most important was the smell. I had to open the windows to get rid of that smell. I guess they accept pets, had I known that I would stay elsewhere. The staff was also just ok, you have to ask several times before they raise their heads from a report they were reading at the reception. Overall: overpriced, noisy from the street and a little further from Union Square that I wanted. Next time in SF, I will stay elsewhere. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “We've never been disappointed with Kimpton Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: stuckathome007
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Great location if you like being amongst the hustle & bustle... walking distance to everything fun! Valet, underground parking available for a fee which makes it super convenient. Lobby is luxurious and the rooms are well-appointed and quaint. Wasn't completely THRILLED with our room at first (the bathroom just was NOT big enough for me. When I'm away, I want a LUXURIOUS bathroom!) Since it was our anniversary we decided to check into an upgrade. There happened to be a corner-suite available and we grabbed it. LOVED it! HUGE bathroom with ENORMOUS bathtub and shower (with HUGE shower head... felt like you were standing under a waterfall!)... great sitting room and draped-off bedroom off to the side. It really was fantastic! Keep in mind this is an old place that's been renovated... so while it's been remodeled, it also maintains a lot of antique particulars. If you're looking for sleek lines and smooth designs, this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for cozy, restored elegance... you hit the jackpot! Have been here 3 times already and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: CdrAdama
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in July 2011. The hotel was not bad with an impressive lobby, friendly and efficient staff and smart and clean rooms. On the down side there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, the restaurant was closed for renovation (though is soon to reopen) and the bathroom was very small and awkward. As we didn't spend too much time in our room though these things didn't matter too much and the positives outweighed the negative. The most worrying thing though was the location. Whilst walking back one day from the Civic Centre we inadvertently took the western approaches which take you though some bad areas and prompted us to pick up the pace. As long as you use a map though and never walk west of the hotel you should be ok as you are quite close to most major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: jayeriree
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel w/o ever being to SF before. I was a little nervous at first because there was construction on the outside on the building, but we were assured they were done and just removing scaffolding. Needless to say we had a great stay. The rooms are small but nice and clean. The staff was so helpful and nice. The bellhops gave us tips on how to beat the lines for the cable cars.Now that i have been to SF, this hotel is on the cusp of the seedy part of town. I would not stay any father away from powell st.. We walked home from a restaurant on O'Farrell, coming from around Leavenwoth St and although nothing happened, there were lots of homeless folks and people asking us for money, one guy actually followed us to the door of our hotel. So if staying at the Serrano, just hang out towards union square, over that way there was no problems at all at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: VanessaNarotam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family in July 2011 for 4nts. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is in the heart of San Francisco downtown, with Union square 2 blocks away. Market Street - a shopping area is within 2 blocks as well. The restaurant was still being refurbished when we stayed here. The bathroom is extremely tiny! The walls are very thin. What I liked about this hotel was that every morning, they served complimentary tea, coffee and pastries, and in the evenings they had wine and tapenade, and during the day, complimentary juice and iced water was available in the lobby. The lobby is just charming. Would recommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you see”
Reviews.Author: GGZ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is as you see in pictures, no surprises with rooms, it is very clean and quiet. I was there for two different stays, for the first we got a small room with tiny bathroom, just near elevators, we were not very lucky and my impression was not as good as with the second stay, where room had a reasonable size and it was possible to use the washbasin without acrobatics. It is well located, though in the "border". When going out at night move towards Union Square, do not go opposite direction along O'Farrel or Geary St. because there is nothing there you do not want to miss. Hotel Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to the Hilton when attending a conference.”
Reviews.Author: SingleTraveler48
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference just across the street at the Hilton. The "conference rate" was no longer available so I decided to look for other hotels in the area and boy was I glad that I did. The Serano is a lovely, historical boutique hotel. The lobby is lovely and inviting. The lobby seating arrangement lends to socializing with other guests during the wine hour, which is very enjoyable. Some people find the smaller room size to be a negative. I found the room size to be just fine, though I could have used more table space so I can see how that would be an issue for two people in the room. And yes, you have to close the bathroom door to sit on the toilet, but what's the big deal with that? Oh, and my room was totally quiet except for the occasional siren or loud motorcycle out on the street. Join the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program and you will get free internet and free honor bar treats. I also won a bottle of wine at check-in having "Liked" the Kimpton Facebook page and, as a result, know the secret password of the month. Much fun!!! All-in-all, I loved my stay and will most likely return to the Serrano for my conference next year as well!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF...NICE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: freakstar
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in Serrano and I feel very comfortable. This is the 4th hotel on my US trip and the staff are certainly the nicest I have come across - all smile and are very helpful. They are certainly a credit to the hotel and I hope that they are rewarded appropriately. I would call the room cosy (not small) and it is ideal for me. Very comfortable bed although it can be quite loud from outside (one should expect this from a city centre hotel I suppose). The small touches make the difference for me - wine reception each evening, games in the room (gosh I can not make a blooming cube despite my efforts!) and tiger print bath robe. I have had room service which was generally good. The steak was actually overdone but the sauce it came with cancelled this out. Breakfast was fair (comparable with the other hotels I have been to here ie nothing special). Oh and why do hotels in US insist in delivering poached eggs in a bowl half full of water - it drives me mad! On the whole, I am very happy with the Serrano, it is a very friendly hotel and there is a genuine feeling that they appreciate your visit with them. I had the opportunity to see part of the restaurant that they are currently refurbishing and this should be a welcome addition. I would certainly look to book this hotel again when I visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “love the location”
Reviews.Author: zeegeeSacramento
Reviews.Content: although it is an older building, it feels cozy... the rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. I like the fact that a garage is next door where I can go in and not have to valet each time. it is a mere 2 blocks from union square.. coffee is provided along with a variety of newspapers each morning. wine from 5 to 6. overall a great choice and the special rates are great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the Kimptons”
Reviews.Author: uffda1
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent guest of Kimpton Hotels, having stayed in about 15 different properties in the last 12 months. This one definitely rates as the worst of the Kimptons. The doorman didn't even make eye contact when I entered, my room is the teeniest I've seen, the elevator floor was splashed with water, the elite amenity was less than any of the other Kimptons have provided, and if this room was renovated I hope they paid the contractor minimum wage. I won't stay here again and am disappointed that Kimpton has this property in its portfolio as it does not meet their typically high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Family”
Reviews.Author: MnMsMemo
Reviews.Content: We had an executive suite that included a king bed and a pull-out sofa. The bed was very comfy but the sofa still felt like a sofa, however, it served its purpose. One drawback: when the sofa was pulled out, you had to climb over the sofa bed to reach the bathroom- a real pain at 3:00 am. The positives: 1) Clean 2) The afternoon wine hour was nice and the gentleman in charge of serving the wine was very charming and generous. 3)The concierge service was very effificient and Stephan was very accomodating and gave us accurate information about public transportation. 4) Great location! Cons: 1) 10.00 a day for wireless (which seems crazy in this economy). 2) Jacuzzi did not work after our first night. 3) Parking was steep- about 40.00 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: This is an old style hotel that still keeps its old arquitecture and decorationut. The rooms and bathrom are small but clean. Although the Restaurant was closed for renovation they offer some options for Breakfast. The staff is great with good customer focus Just two blocks from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly updated”
Reviews.Author: RocketrobMiami
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but could have been much better. The bedding was clean, but not spotless. The furnishings were nice, but had chips. Worse, the closet had no air outlet and thus smelled of mildew. The bath/shower was curtained so that there was no totally safe way to get in and out. I pity an older customer. The air system could have been cleaner. As the hotel has recently been renovated, these testify to an unthinking designer. There are better, equally expensive, options in the Union Square enighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: gbellamy
Reviews.Content: Roms are on the small side, but sufficient for vintage downton hotel. Very clean and nice. Pleasant and helpful staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Union Square”
Reviews.Author: MrSanFranUSA
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what you should expect for the price in Union Square. Nothing really too special about this place. It's clean and the location is great. They have a complimentary wine hour in the lobby from 5-6pm which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cocowilli
Reviews.Content: great location!!!!! smallest bathroom in the world. had a hard time just brushing my teeth. dirty..even the elevators doors and floor. construction on the outside of the building. Restaurant needed big scrub down beds were old and like sleeping in a hamock front desk was not too welcoming and on check out did not even ask if we enjoyed. maybe for a single traveler that never had to be in the room

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TomR82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May of 2010, the hotel was under going some restoration and at first I was worried due to it looking shabby, however I couldent be more wrong, it was excellent all the way. Great staff helped me with some tour bookings, very friendly and good value for money. Rooms were tidy and clean, the hotel is a brisk walk from nice locations and close to the BART. I'd stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Len2day
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a 4 day conference. The room was small, but it had all the necessities (table, 1 chair, dresser, small closet) , and full sized bath tub (one of my requirements). Staff was friendly & courteous. Had a small fitness center, but it was perfect for my needs, was not over crowded. Building is tall & narrow, but I never had to wait long for elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: jessly09
Reviews.Content: The Serrano is located a few blocks from Union Square where there are a lot of restaurants and shops. Unfortunately, a few blocks south of this hotel is near the Tenderloin, so we stayed away from that area. This hotel was also in walking distance to Chinatown and the North Beach, about a mile or so. They offer a free wine reception from 5-6 every night and coffee every morning from 5-10. We didn't order room service, but the menu looked good. The staff was extremely helpful, recommending various restaurants and offering us directions and to hold our baggage. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family vacation, kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Aggiecane
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family in a suite, great room! Three blocks away from Union Square, great service, kid friendly staff and useful concierge, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SLEEP, GREAT STAFF, GREAT VALUE = GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Shrekyboy
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a week. We had three rooms. Everyone in our group had great things to say about their trip. The location is perfect. The rooms were very clean, every day. The staff are very accommodating and efficient - especially John, the doorman. The internet worked well. The beds were great and the a/c worked perfectly. The rooms were quiet for an older, downtown property. I have stayed at Kimpton hotels for years. Last year, I stayed at the Hotel Vintage Park in Seattle. I had a miserable stay. The heating cooling-system didn't work at all. The staff there were terrible and had no desire or ability to rectify my problem. Needless to say, I was reluctant to stay in another Kimpton property. But, the stay at the Serrano has changed my mind about Kimpton hotels again. I'll definately choose this group again (except the Vintage Park in Seattle). I can't say enough for the wonderful week and would definitley recommend the SERRANO HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Small and old, but nice, and clean, and good deal for the location”
Reviews.Author: NPotomac4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week with our family (2 adults and 2 kids - 10 and 7). The deal we got was pretty decent - San Franciso is quite expensive. The location was great - 2 blocks from the cable cars and 3 blocks from Union Square. There were plenty of shops and restaurants within a few blocks. As long as you didn't travel west of the hotel at night, the neighborhood was fine. The hotel is in an old building, but the outside is getting a makeover. The lobby is beautiful, and the rooms were nice and quiet, but small. The bathroom had next to zero counter space, but the shower came out like a power washer. Beds were comfy, but a little soft. Room had HD satellite TV. Every evening from 4 to 5 they had free wine, spring-water, and sparkling cider, and very inexpensive happy-hour snacks in the restaurant, which was nice. Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service and Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: keviha
Reviews.Content: My family literally just checked out (4/19/11 @ 12P) of two rooms (503 & 507) in what can only be described as a horrendous and mentally scarring stay at Serrano Hotel. Before I recount my experience, I should point out we've stayed at this hotel at least 12 times in the past 6 years, and have enjoyed our stays, but after this trip, never again. Let me start at the end...and that was getting a call from my out of country family member (visiting from Montreal) that she had bites all over her legs. Uh oh....here we go. We've never experienced bed bugs. We quickly packed (it was a quick overnight trip) and went downstairs to check out and inform front of house that they had issues with bed bugs. What we experienced at that point was disbelief and utter rudeness. My cousin tried to show the staff member who checked us out (Pam Davis) her bites, but she would have none of it and quickly dismissed our complaints in an extremely rude manner. In the meantime, my 3 year old daughter has bites, as does my mom. All in all, there were 5 of us in two rooms, and eveyone has bites on their legs! The manager (Jana Syquia) was at least cordial, but she was indifferent to our plight and her only comment was to fill out a report. Ridiculous! Clearly, the staff at the Serrano do not care about their customers because by not taking us seriously and just looking at our legs for themselves, they are going to continue renting bed bug infested rooms 503 and 507 (and who knows how many other rooms) to unsuspecting travelers with bed bugs. Shame on you Serrano Hotel and Kimpton Hotel management!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: UMS
Reviews.Content: Hard to located because of construction. Upon arrival my room was not ready, however the front desk staff member was very friendly and happily provided me with an upgrade that was ready (this was much appreciated after a long day of meetings/travel). This is definitely an older hotel, but the elevator was fast and the rooms were clean and well appointed. The bed is VERY comfortable and sheets very soft. Aveda bath amenities are great. The bar has great happy hour specials on drinks and small bites of food.

Reviews.Title: “Sound sleep for a sick traveler”
Reviews.Author: wendy153
Reviews.Content: This was my first time travelling to San Francisco and it was to attend a conference at the Hilton. I became sick with a chest cold immediately upon arrival, and without the plush bedding and quiet of my 17th floor room at the Serrano I likely would have missed the entire conference! I stayed in a corner room and it was tiny, but it was perfect for me as I was travelling alone. The bathrobes are delightful and the towels were plush! Not grizzled and over-used like you so often get at hotels. I'm so glad I stayed at the Serrano for my conference. The Serrano was kitty-corner from the Hilton and included free wi-fi (unlike the Hilton which has twice the room rate!) and unlimited tea in the morning (I came back more than once to fight my cold!) My conference-mates complained of uncomfortable bedding at the Hilton and I slept soundly every night. Also, the bell-men were the cutest I saw in San Francisco! Quick with a smile and super helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Worse stay of our 10 day 25th anniversary trip! Really disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: 25thannivtrip
Reviews.Content: Had a hard time finding hotel because they are doing construction on outside. On the 2nd call, they finally mentioned the construction. Unless you are in to theater themed rooms, not the place to stay. After visiting sites all day until 10 PM and was cold, just wanted a cup of coffee or tea to warm us up. All they had in the lobby was cold water and no coffee pot in room. Had stayed at another hotel the night we arrived, we were greeted with champagne, snacks & card for our 25th anniv., here not even a welcome to our hotel!! Had asked them to make reservations for shuttle to Oak airport, and after the 3rd time asking, we made them ourselves. The last night was looking for comment card & found the brochure about the InTouch program, which said you could have 2 things from the Honors Bar. Went downstairs to see if they had us as members, which they did. He then gave me a card for the 2 drinks that should have been given at check-in, not 5 hrs. before leaving! Had read reviews from others that they got champagne, chocolates etc. for their anniv. Had made a comment when reserving the room that it was our 25th. We received wine, earrings, desserts...something from every place we went during our 10 day trip. Every time we passed the hotel from the 1st night, we kept wishing we had stayed there. Only a block away, but didn't have to deal with not feeling safe at night. Not the memorable ending we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to arrive in San Fran -location great and helpful service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Super comfy beds, staff helped with bookings and car rentals and printing. 5 to 10 minute walk to Union Square (main shopping & transport hub) and Market Street. Very pet friendly, didn't have time to eat there so don't know about the food but everything else was great. Recent construction works were nearly complete but we didn't notice a thing. Not supermodern, more of a character hotel. Good price online.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: BetsyHK
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here for a conference and can't speak highly enough of the experience. Should I start with the the lobby with beautifully painted beamed ceilings and huge sofas and armchairs that beckon you to sink into them, the daily wine tasting, the friendly staff who helped with restaurant recommendations and took the initiative to try to track down my booking and then find me another van to the airport when my reservation had been lost, the cozy room with luxury bedding, I-Pod dock, and reasonably priced well stocked mini-bar, the bathroom with lovely tiles and plush towels or the perfect location - 5 minutes from Union Squares, 10 minutes up to Nob Hill, or 15 minutes from the conference center? There is fine coffee and a variety of teas available in the lobby in the morning. My only suggestion would be that it be available all day or that the hotel provide hot water kettle so that guests can make tea or coffee in their rooms. This will absolutely be my choice for my next trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Send in the clowns”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced boutique-style hotel with some stylish details, though I kept expecting a clown to pop out from behind the circus-striped curtains in the room! Housekeeping was very good, Aveda toiletries, and the complimentary New York Times and (good) coffee in the am and wine tasting in the evening were nice touches. Room 604 was a corner room facing south and west, with a view of the SROs in the "historic" Tenderloin. Interesting location: Great ethnic restaurants in the area and a short, steep walk up to the top of Nob Hill. Union Square is just a couple of blocks away, but if you walk in the other direction, you are in a pretty rough neighborhood. The room was tight--it really needed end tables on BOTH sides of the bed. No comfortable chair, just an ottoman. Still, at a special rate of $179, it was perfectly fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second time”
Reviews.Author: noslen00
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and the staff is great. The suite is a better option if you can. Ask for upgrade or sing in for one in the kimptom website. Is just 49 dollars extra a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlegiant10
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco while on a college visit for our son. When I was deciding where to book our stay, I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and was very impressed with the way Mr JO Pagoadacruz responded to all the reviews. I booked a suite for 4 of us and emailed him to get his advice on our level of room for our stay. He immediately upgraded us to a larger suite which was a corner room. I was having difficulty viewing a photo of our type of room online and he offered to go up to the room and photograph it right then. We loved our stay in this hotel. Yes, there is a renovation going on. No, it didn't affect our stay. The suite we stayed in was very spacious, yet cozy and quiet. The breakfasts were nice also in the quaint little restaurant just off the lobby. We would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation - nicer boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Ok, now I normally stay in national/international hotel chains (Sheraton, Hilton, Hyatt, etc.) so my views may be a little slanted. This is an older hotel (I was told it was built before the 1906 earthquake - not sure if that is true, but I would believe it). It has that older boutique feel, to the point where I almost felt like I was in someoneâ€™s grandma's house. The furniture in my room was dinged up, the baseboards were dented, scuffed, marked and the floor in my room was warped. Now some may call this cozy, I would call it â€˜â€�in need of an updateâ€�. The bathroom was very small with virtually no place to put a toiletries bag. This is a nit, but the shower nozzle was placed so high on the wall, if I was 2â€� shorter I couldn't have reached it â€“ kind of odd. Whereâ€™s the power outlet??? The room had an ironing board and iron, which I needed to use. But, whereâ€™s the power outlet that can be used? I had to move the desk chair between the beds to access a power outlet, which caused limited movement of the iron. Again, kind of odd. As I noted there is renovation on-going, but it didnâ€™t really cause me any issues, however, there was constant police/ambulance action throughout the night, which awoke me several times. I probably wouldnâ€™t stay there again, since there is a Hilton right across the street, as I didnâ€™t really see it as a real value, nor a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Michimoko
Reviews.Content: I had lovely stay at the Serrano SF back in December last year. Stayed there with a friend of mine in a room with two beds. Very friendly hotel staff. The bed was comfortable enough. In terms of location, the hotel is just few blocks away from Downtown SF with all the shopping and dining options. Comp. internet access for Kimpton In Touch members which is free to sign up. Wine reception at the lobby nightly as well. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, especially for Union Sq. location”
Reviews.Author: jeff6
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very nice room. If they would knock down the price of business services (something like $15 for 15 mins of internet!), it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel/ LOUD construction!”
Reviews.Author: parkplace09
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how to rate this hotel because I would give it 4 or 5 stars based on the decor, the comfortable bed, the friendly staff, and the amenities. However, there is construction going on now, and the noise in the morning was very loud. We were not given any warning about this when booking the room or checking in. There was a note on the desk informing us about construction, but it said it would not start until 9 am and would be 'intermittent low level.' But the noise started closer to 8 am, and it was very loud! We put in ear plugs and turned on a white noise machine but that didn't come close to drowning it out. I am sure we got a cheaper rate on the room due to the noise, but I am not sure if they should be renting out these rooms with that much construction going on. I don't think most rooms got that much noise, so just make sure to ask about it when you book the room or check in.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Business getaway in Hotel Serrano”
Reviews.Author: Clarkinva
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to San Francisco for a conference, and stayed at the Hotel Serrano for a discounted conference rate. Though we requested a king room, we were originally placed in a tiny room with a double bed, but after calling the front desk they quickly moved us to a huge king room with tons of space and a great view of Nob Hill. The hotel was within easy walking distance to all the tourist sites (all the way to Coit Tower, Convention Center, and everywhere) and we rented a car one day to go to Muir Woods and Point Reyes National Seashore, but overnight parking was a nightmare so only rent cars if absolutely necessary. The wine happy hour was a nice treat each evening, and we were sometimes greeted with hot spiced cider for the cold rainy evenings. The fitness center was small but sufficient. The bed was SO comfortable I never wanted to wake up! One night after walking a friend back to her hotel in a sketchy area near the Civic Center, we found ourselves on streets with prostitutes and unsavory characters, surprisingly only blocks away from the hotel, but then realized the better routes to take in order to stay safe! I loved the hotel .. can't wait to go back on my next trip to San Francisco. Sears is a must for breakfast (corned beef hash.. heavenly!) even if there is a line out the door! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dallasite50
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, the hotel was built in 1926. Very decorative ceiling. Smaller hotel, so it is homey, and the staff was nice. For a hotel this size and age, the room was small but not cramped. The bathroom was small (pedestal sink, no counter) but with good-sized bathtub and nice granite floor. Luxury bedding--some of the softest sheets I've had. I had a corner room, which had nice windows, and nice decor. I went to the bar for the wine hour and they have great, inexpensive "bite" food. Good location at O'Farrell and Taylor streets, close to Union Square. (South on Taylor street is not comfortable at night though.) I am looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Sleek”
Reviews.Author: myla2009
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2x at this hotel since its close to moscone where some of our corp events are held... its good, the hotel is small, service is good since they dont have a lot of guests, the rooms are well made /decorated and important its clean. Close to some good resto that are not pricey . only concern is bec its in downtown theres a bit of tolerable noise during late night. They have the afternoon wine too so its good to hangout at the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, amazing service and a really great price!”
Reviews.Author: Greenie91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Serrano for 2 nights during October in a trip to the us from Australia. After being in LA for a week before SFO it was amazing tO get to the Serrano and relax on the amazing beds, in the lobby on the oversized chairs. A great hotel with great service in a good location. Would return in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms, exceptionaly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KAZ2028
Reviews.Content: This is my second year staying at the Serrano. Whilst some rooms are a little tired around the edges, they are always spotlessly clean and the beds are really comfortable. Only a very short walk from Union Square, so you almost get the location, but you certainly don't get the price tag. If you are coming and going during the day and want a coffee - the nearest Starbucks is in the Hilton just across the intersection, and there is a great little breakfast place just down the road to the right after you cross the street. We didn't eat at Ponzu this year after our experiences last year. The only problem I do have with this hotel - and it has not changed since last year - is that because of the very large (and impressive) floor to ceiling front doors opening on an sensor system that keeps them open for quite a while after guests pass through, the lobby does get cold. This is only really a problem if you wait for other guests in the lobby or stay for the wine hour. And the only additional gripe during that hour is that there simply are not enough seats for everyone. That said, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff fall over themselves to be helpful, and with the added bonus of free wifi and $10 voucher for the mini bar - why would you stay elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: MichaelGChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayted at the Serrano for 3 nights around Christmas. The hotel is old/a bit dated, but the rooms were nice and clean. The staff was friendly for the most part. We used their valet parking option for $30/night, and they took good care of our car. Overall, good location, decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property in the heart of SF's Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: BallyvaughnGirl
Reviews.Content: The Serrano is located in a great spot if you are going to Union Square shopping or the Theatre District. It is literally right around the corner from the ACT theatre and 10 min walk to Macy's in Union Sq. Because of location, a bit noisy, but to be expected when you stay in a city. It's on a side street so it's not as noisy as it could be. The rooms remind me of European rooms, quaint, small but very nicely decorated. The beds are the best with feather pillows and down comforters. The staff is very very nice. They go out of their way to help you. They offer free wine/champagne every night from 5-6pm which we enjoyed! Their is a parking garage right next door and another one across the street. They charge about 30.00 for 24hrs. We took the ferry down and then public transportation to the hotel. Next time, we will drive, it's worth the convenience and not a whole lot more. I will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Serrano was good value and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: cayvman
Reviews.Content: Checked in early ~ 2 pm. Room was ready. Room was on the top floor, away from the elevator as requested. The room was great. View was of the Tenderloin District. Not a problem. Vicinity of said District was not a problem as well. Location was ideal. Staff was very hospitable and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff Makes the Trip So Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Bettertoons
Reviews.Content: I was stressed out because I inadvertently booked the trip off by a day, and showed up a day late. Booked via Hotels.com so figured this would be a big fiasco (costing me time for sure and maybe money... ouch). But turns out the most friendly and helpful professional at the front desk (Pam), was there to the rescue. She just asked me to explain the problem, and then went into "take care of it" mode. While I was out having lunch at the wharf with the family, she was calling hotels.com to sort it all out. I'm going to be looking to stay with Kimpton moving forward in hopes all their staff are this personable and helpful. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jspracher
Reviews.Content: Friendly, warm, and welcoming hotel! Beautiful room, great sauna, attentive staff, and terrific location. We were able to easily walk to MoMA, Union Square, and Ferry Building. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay in the Kimptonâ€™s hotels!”
Reviews.Author: I-flower
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Serrano Hotel San Francisco of Kimpton Hotel & Restaurant Group our car was damaged by hotelâ€™s valet parking (more than $3400 for repair). My husband spent more than 2 months for back and forth communications (phone calls, e-mails, letters) with Serrano Hotel, with Kimpton Group and with Hotel's insurance company - Risk Control Systems, specifically with Mr. Liscomb who was not friendly and collaborative at all. Because we had not seen any progress we were forced to activate OUR insurance in OUR insurance company to fix damages that was caused by FAULT of KIMPTON's HOTEL. â€¦Not too lucky final, right? To summaries: we received EXTREMELY LOW QUALITY treatment for the Kimptonâ€™s fault. We will never stay in the Kimptonâ€™s hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaSix1983
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in August 2010. It was a wonderful stay; the staff were really friendly and very helpful. They advised of good places to visit and the places that should perhaps be avoided. Our room was more than enough for our stay - bed was really comfy and the room a really good size. Bathroom was a little on the small side but this was no big deal. Free hot drinks were available in the mornings which was a nie little touch. Location was great and only a short walk from Union Square. Would highly recommend this hotel; it's definitely hood value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: PLRod
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Serrano about a year ago and did not leave a review at the time. But I've got to say that the stay there was wonderful. Great location and literally a few minutes from Union Square. The staff was great and very helpful. We would absolutely stay there again. Actually we plan to. Didn't know about the free breakfast vouches though. I will be looking into those.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Clemsongal42
Reviews.Content: First let me say I love Kimpton hotels and having stayed at the Argonaut a few years ago I was happy to find out our friends had chosen a Kimpton hotel for their visit to the city so my husband and I booked a room and traveled with our dog. I love being able to take my dog with us and not have to pay a $50-$75 pet fee but I feel like this hotel falls short in other ways. First the negatives, this hotel has a really small cramped feeling. I know it is part of older buildings but this is very small. We had a corner room with barely enough room to walk around the bed let alone lay your suitcase out. Also, itt was suppose to have a city view, our city view was billboard of a guy smiling right at us. The elevators are really difficult during heavy traffic times because of their size and people trying to fit their luggage. The darkness of a the hotel gives it a bit of a run down feeling. Now the positives, they do have a wine hour which is great and the customer service we had at the front desk and from the doorman was excellent. I think it is 3 stars all around.... We stayed at the Westin down near Market with our dog a couple of months ago, the price is not that much different but comfort wise I would have to say I will be staying at the Westin from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Snatching Defeat from the Jaws of Victory”
Reviews.Author: campas
Reviews.Content: We had four good nights in the Serrano. It is a great old building with lots of history, and Kimpton is doing a nice job keeping the character of the old Serrano while they modernize. Yes, you have to get coffee in the lobby, but the stacks of New York Times and Wall Street Journals are there as well. The in-house restaurant does a good job with breakfast. The staff in the lobby were terrific - it felt like coming home after a busy day or evening in the city. The room cleaning crews were fast and professional. It all went great until checkout at 6 in the morning. The night front desk guy mistook us for another couple, refused to give us a receipt and was rude to my wife. Would we stay there again? Yes, but we'd have to hope that the night guy is either retrained or replaced. One hint - if you are driving in the next few months, you'll recognize the hotel by its external scaffolding. The Serrano sign is hard to see.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyGalway
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great! Location is brilliant, very comfortable & spacious rooms. The little details in the room were cute - packs of cards, 'Etch-a-sketch' & maps! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel although room was small”
Reviews.Author: TONY1611
Reviews.Content: Had four days at the Hotel was given a room on the tenth floor, it was nice but the bathroom was so small it was very difficult to have shower or basically wash. Was given free breakfast vouchers (continental) added bonus. Free coffee and tea every morning along with free wine tasting between 5 and 6pm although it was the same wine everyday but hey it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: mannequin70
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed a week at the Kimpton, on vacation in SF. The hotel was undergoing exterior renovations at the time. The lobby is adorable and the staff were very friendly. We requested a room on the upper floors and were given a room on the 14th floor at no extra charge. The room itself (2 double beds) was really tiny; definitely could not have more than 2 people in the room. Great view but the windows were filthy from the renovations. Bathroom was also extremely tiny, not much place to put your dop kit etc. Beds were comfortable and clean, towels also clean. The room had a faint smell of old cigarettes, they could probably get rid of that if they replaced the carpets - it was pretty musty, fortunately I always carry a scented travel candle for this type of situation. We used it every night in the room. One other incident, there was a blood spatter under the sink (from the previous guests) and even after 2 days the cleaning staff had not cleaned it. It was pretty hard to miss; I ended up cleaning it myself, not so good. The location is very close to Union Square, and even though I read reviews that warned about the neighborhood we had no issues walking around at night (mom and daughter). The hotel is right across from the Hilton, so the area is well-lighted. We did not try the restaurant. The valet parking was very expensive. I would recommend this hotel at the rate I got it which was 89$/night plus taxes. At a slightly higher price point there are many other boutique hotel options in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms.......”
Reviews.Author: Treetop_67
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel it was considered a 4 star hotel and I would consider it a 3 star. The room we had was small and a bit tight for 3 people, but it was clean and functional. I liked the Aveda products and the beds were comfy. Parking in SF is outrageous - so be prepared to pay at least $40 a night and you may want to consider that when determining total room costs. I thought the hotel was a bit pricey for what it was. They are working onthe exterior, however, it did not effect our visit. The lobby was small and dark and there was never enough room for us to sit for the wine hour - which was a nice perk - but mediocre wine. I did not mind the neighborhood - and I thought the location was fine. I was not aware of the "friendly" pet policy and not being a big animal lover and somewhat allergic to animal dander - would probably had chosen another hotel. The gym was small - but okay for a workout - basic machines: treadmill, elliptical and stationary bike....free weights. If there were more than a few people in the romm it would be very tight. I did sign up for Klimpton's frequent traveller program as one reviewer had said that there was a fee for internet use if not a member. I am surprised that hotels still charge a fee - on this trip we stayed in 5 hotels and they all offered free in room internet service......not sure if Serrano charges non members for in room use. All in all a fine stay - but for the price we paid I would have preferred a more 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “3 strikes and we wanted out”
Reviews.Author: halo010
Reviews.Content: Room was smaller than the picture on the website and it had a musty odor. The wallpaper, especially near the corners, was dirty and unglued. We noticed the sink was clogged, but we decided to deal with it in the morning since it was late and we were tired from traveling. Later, we realized the bath tub was clogged also. At 4am, we were awoken by a dripping noise and found a puddle of water on the floor. The air-conditioning unit was leaking from the ceiling and at one point sounded as if the water would come through it. On top of all that, we found several small bugs on our bed. We were able to switch rooms, but only after the reception staff initially said there were no rooms available. Since the manager wasn't available until 10am, we did some sightseeing and came back later in the day. When we brought up the issues with the manager, he immediately became defensive and his first response was that the staff didn't find any bed bugs, as if to imply that I was making it up. They did, however, find the sink and bath tub clogged and the ceiling leaking. I doubt even one of the above conditions would be acceptable in the hotel industry. However, all 3 existed in our room. I would've been content with an initial apology, but that didn't come until the conversation became heated in front of other guests. It was obvious that the hotel was old. Major construction was being performed to the exterior facade, but the hotel interior could have used some attention as well.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, fun and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: padmasana
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was construction on the exterior of the hotel, but the staff made up for the construction. There was complimentary wine every evening from 5:30-6:30 and the staff was sincere and helpful. Our room was clean and the bathroom was very big! The hotel was in a great spot close to to the Bart station and minutes away from great breakfast. Oh, and the hotel restaurant was very hip with specials every night!

Reviews.Title: “Great value boutique hotel in the center of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Brittam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Kimptons in other cities and it is really worth joining their free club/membership, I always have a great stay and the customer service is always good. The room was a little dusty in places - such as the lamps, windows and the carpet needed a clean. Other than this I loved the room, the style is really unique. The bed wasn't five star, but it was clean and comfortable. There was etch-a-sketch, playing cards and other games, although I didn't actually play any, this is a really nice touch. They have free coffee/tea in the mornings and wine in the evenings and free papers. Room Service - food was excellent, big portions and well priced. Above average. Parking - $40 for valet but there are garages everywhere (including one door down) for $30. I also found one a couple blocks away for $20 with a hotel receipt. At Hotel Serrano I experienced the fastest check-in at any hotel I've been to - it was less than 1 minute. Something I really appreciated after a long day of traveling. Check-out was longer than it needed to be so I guess it depends who you get. After I left I received an additional charge for the mini-bar. I had to call twice to get this cleared up since I paid in full for my charges. I spoke to the manager; he wasn't very friendly and didn't apologize, but he did agree to take off the charge although he said it like it was a favor to me. The location - I don't love this location although I've stayed in this area twice. There are a lot of brothels and riff-raff but also a lot of tourists, theaters and nightlife buzz. Next time I'll be staying in china town or nob hill but if I was back in this area I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Tenderloin, but close to EVERYTHING else”
Reviews.Author: Salbolal
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's pretty close to the Tenderloin. Hey, if you don't want that, go to the Four Seasons. ....because the hotel is beautiful and comfortable and has great boutique hotel character and for the most part, really good staff who know you personally and care. LA few short blocks off Union Square, Market Street and the F Line, and the Powell Street cable car line.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem at the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: 2bladertgrl88
Reviews.Content: Exterior renovations detracted from the delightfulness of our stay, but the room and location more than made up for it since there was little disruption in our access to the hotel or our comfort. The room was charming and we totally enjoyed the complimentary happy hour after our daily excursions.

Reviews.Title: “quirky but cool”
Reviews.Author: tdfayar
Reviews.Content: Had recent three day stay at Serrano SF. we always enjoy kimpton hotels and this was no exception. Had a great top floor room with a great city views. staff was great and helped with all our requests. while right on the edge of tenderloin dont let that bother you, its a easy walk to union square or market street. lobby was cool and of course the kimpton wine tastings are always fun. great way to meet and chat with other guests. while they are doing a renovation it was no problem and didnt bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “small room but clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: justmeLilburnGA
Reviews.Content: They are doing outside renovation but we didn't mind going under scaffolding to go into front door. It was nice and the staff were friendly. It was a bit of a pain to wait for the one working elevator for a couple of days but then other one was working too. My only concern was the size of our room and bathroom. We had a corner room with a king size bed and the bathroom was tiny! Literally the toilet was 3" from the wall. I did see other rooms down the hall and they appeared larger. We walked from the hotel to Union Station all the time; don't go in the other direction ( too many bums) but I wasn't ever concerned. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “quaint hotel in average location”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel by myself on a short sight seeing trip in San Francisco. The room was spacious enough for one person with a comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom was small but bearable. The services were very good including the gym which I used each day, the complimentary coffee and tea available in the lobby each morning and the happy hour in the bar/restaurant. The location was okay, however, previous reviews were correct when they said the neighbouring streets were a little "dodgy." The only complaint is that the people in the neighbouring room were quite noisy on two nights and the noise travelled. I would recommend this hotel, particularly if you can get a great rate like I did on expedia

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Krisnicali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for 5 days. If this Hotel was not a "Boutique" it would be a 41/2 Star Property. The staff and service were tops. The Hotle had a cozy and warm feeling. Whoever did the interior decorating for both the hotel and restaurant should get some sort of industry award. The only drwarback is the location as it is on the border of the seedier part ot town. Howver this is more then compensated by the fact that you could walk to everything. The major shops and stores; theaters, restaurants and bars and the trolly. I have stayed at many of the finest properties including Ritz-Carlton's. This property is a cousin. I definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples”
Reviews.Author: littlegemni
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a trip to San Francisco for our anniversary. We really enjoyed staying at the Serrano hotel (Kimpton Hotel) during our stay in the city. The location was great, extremely close to restaurants, shopping, and the cable/trolly cars. Additionally, the rooms were fairly roomy (by San Fran standards) and well appointed. The staff was extremely helpful and we enjoyed the complimentary wine reception in the evening. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Chef with a heart !”
Reviews.Author: bonnie_datta
Reviews.Content: It was my friend's birthday -- I spoke with the chef (of Ponzu) in the evening whether it was possible to arrange for a cake to bring in the birthday at midnight --- he was so charming & helpful & served up this beautiful platter of awesome desserts plus a cake & most importantly did all of that personally! Now thats what I call customer service --- this hotel won my heart and am so staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby”
Reviews.Author: MandyPlymouthEngland
Reviews.Content: Nice & close to Union Square & the shops. The lobby was very pretty which made up for the scaffolding outside. Rooms were comfortable (the leopard print dressing gowns were a nice touch) There is complimentary coffee in the lobby - we were not told about this so did not take advantage of it until the last day - also wasn't told about the wine tasting either (but we were probably out & about at that time each day). The bar/restaurant was very friendly but as with everywhere in San Francisco it was expensive! I would recommend the boat trip around the bay which takes you under the Golden Gate Bridge & very close to Alcatraz (great for photographs) Fishermans Wharf is nice for shops and restaurants too. We took the BART from the airport (approx 8 dollars each) get off at Powell Street & the Serrano is only a ten minute walk from the station. It was a great service. The buses were very efficient - only 2 dollars per trip (the trams were 5 dollars!) make sure if you get a tram you don't bother until it has room as you will not enjoy the experience if you are stood squashed in the middle unable to take in the views - our tram conductor was very rude to some people - pushing them (he made one lady cry)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: 042111b
Reviews.Content: I love the Kimpton Hotels in general. They are all so fabulous. Serrano is just as trendy and modern as the other Kimptons. Super staff too. We got a fantastic corner room for the price we paid. They also have mini-events like wine tastings, which is neat. The only drawback is that it's close to the Tenderloin. A little sketchy, but nothing an urban warrior like myself couldn't handle. We spent most of our time in the other neighborhoods anyway. But others might not feel the same way though, which is why I mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: guppy4
Reviews.Content: The Serrano is a cute boutique hotel near Union Square. The location is pretty good for accessing most of the tourist sites around the city. The view is not picturesque, but that's no different than any of other hotels near Union Square. When we stayed there the exterior of the building was covered with scaffolding. Not pretty, but it didnt bother us at all. The lobby is nicely decorated and comfortable -- as in, not stark or stuffy.. They offer free coffee in the morning (yeah!) and a wine reception at night (which I wanted to go to but was never there at the right time). My room had a large, very comfortable king bed. The linens stood out because they had an elegant, European feel. The bathroom was fairly large, with a deep bath. They had great smelling toiletries -- maybe Aveda? And who couldn't love a place with leopard guest robes in the closet? (If you don't think that's cool, then this may not be the style of hotel you're looking for.) The front desk service was good. I don't think they have a concierge, though, so the dining recommendations by the front desk can be a bit off. (They recommended a pizza place we loved, but another of their restaurant recommendations was terrible and overpriced.) The best part about staying there was the rate we found. We started out with a great discounted rate of $153, which was definitely the best I found for anything comparable in the city for our dates. I had intended to pick a price that included breakfast, but didn't see any note of that when I looked at our confirmation. Just to be sure I emailed them. Turns out I hadn't booked a package with breakfast. But they said that they were going to have a 24-hour online sale the following day and would give me that rate of $114 per night!! It didn't include breakfast either, but we were happy with buying juice and pastries down the block. Check-in and check-out were easy, with no surprises. I definitely recommend this as a nice hotel, with very good rates. And if you're willing to keep an eye on the hotel's website, you might end up with a rate that's almost too good to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's Purpose.”
Reviews.Author: gambone33
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in san francisco, so i knew we wouldn't much time in the hotel. So i picked the serrano for its price and I knew it was a Kimpton Hotel so it can't be that bad. And I was right. If I go back would I stay their again no. The hotel is not in a great location, when we would tell people where we are staying they all said be careful. The rooms were nice very but small bathroom's. The only issue was that the closet door and the bathroom door didn't close. They are doing construction but did not hear any noise. Overall if you looking for an inexpensive hotel and going out all day/night I would pick this on.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: C_livingstone
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel well located being quite near Union square although the area is quite scruffy and there are lots of beggars who hassle you for cash. (this seems a problem all over the city). The rooms are fairly spacious for a city hotel with comfortable beds and good bathrooms. Coffee in the lobby from 5 to 10am was a real bonus to a jet lagged family! Biggest problem with this place is they are undergoing a huge refurbishment and this means work on the outside of the building every day and it's pretty noisy so check before you go that this is finished. Also don't rent your car at the airport parking is expensive in the city and car rental just round the corner from this hotel. Finally don't expect to have a nighcap here - The bar closed at 10pm!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: paula_joe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the Serrano. The room was clean, comfortable, cosy dressing gowns, fabulous bed and contained everything we needed. The hotel has some exterior work going on but we didn't hear a thing and we certainly aren't early risers so i wouldn't worry about the work. The hotel had nice added extras such as tea & coffee in lobby in morning, fresh lemonade in the afternoon and wine tasting int the evening. The happy hour appetisers in the resteraunt were great so we really enjoyed sipping a glass of complimentary wine, muching on some calamari while having a quick game of scrabble. The hotel do have a game of 21 you can play when checking in to see if you can win a complimentary upgrade but we didn't realise this until later - so do have a go at that. Location was good ust a few blocks and you are in the heart of union square so great location for shopping and heading on to see the San Franciso sights.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation works @ Serrano”
Reviews.Author: Pernilleskokken
Reviews.Content: The renovation works will be going on until Feb 2011 and the workers are working from 9am to 4.30pm. Other than that, the room isn't very quiet since you can hear noise (lifts?) from the hallway. No coffee making facilities in the room was disappointing. Comfy bed. Lots of boardgames to borrow. Luggage storage. Free wifi when you become a member of kimpton (free to be a member too) and it works in all kimptons. The area west and south of hotel is a bit shabby, especially west. Nice sushi restaurant called Sakana, on Post, 2 blocks up from hotel. Nice bistro restaurant on 4th street, on the other side of Market Street (Annabelle Bar and Bistro) - 5-10min walk.

Reviews.Title: “So cute, great ecclectic style, friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: BunnyMpls33
Reviews.Content: The Serrano was a gem of a hotel. The rooms were adorable and immaculately clean, the beds were incredibly comfortable and the sheets and pillows were delightful to sleep in. I was with my family and they were very helpful with tourist ideas and the kind of restaurant we were looking for, sending us to places that weren't too touristy and part of the locals, which is what we wanted and asked for. We had 2 little ones with us and the staff was warm and welcoming to all of us. It's an older hotel and eclectic in style, but that's part of its charm. They offer complimentary coffee and tea in the morning and nice cool lemon water in the afternoon. The shower water pressure was awesome in all of our rooms - the one thing we all raved about! And the Aveda products were a nice amenity. Minimal noise from being in Union Square area. A few blocks away is a little dicey of a neighborhood, but it's safe and secure around the hotel and there'd be no reason to venture that way anyway. It's really close to all of the Union Square activity. I'd definitely stay here again. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: travelermuc27
Reviews.Content: Staid here on business for 5 nights and was, overall, quite pleased. My room was on the 17th floor so the view was great, but the windows don't open at all (there is an extra glass pane against the sash window) so, sadly, none of the fresh SF air. The windows could have used some washing because and make the view even more beautiful. The room was very large, clean and well appointed. The hotel is extremely well situated, close to everything one needs plus BART and MUNI. Really, the only thing missing to make me completely happy would have been a window to open.

Reviews.Title: “Was disappointed by the charges I found...”
Reviews.Author: stewai01
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed by the charges I found on my credit card after checking out of the Hotel and being told there were no outstanding charges. We did not touch anything in the mini bar so do not understand where the charges have come from. I have contacted the hotel through their website and facebook and after three days am still to get a response!!! Talk about customer service ??? Wine hour at the Hotel is ok ( we were expecting some different wines.... Not the same ones everyday) as long as you can track back to the hotel between 5-6 in the evening. And there is not much to do at night around the hotel district ( restaurants etc.. Seem to be in different parts of the city). Taylor street coffee shop is a must for breakfast and if you need any help or advice from any staff member at the hotel be site to look out for Trey ( the one saving grace the hotel has to offer, nothing is too much trouble)

Reviews.Title: “Dog-friendly hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pilarkitty
Reviews.Content: This place is very nice. It's a boutique hotel which comes with its own positives and negatives. It's within a 10 minute walk of Union Square and the Convention Center and sits right before the super steep hill on Taylor Street. The rooms were smaller than average than other hotels, but this seems to be the norm in San Francisco. They have a water dish for dogs at the entrance, but I didn't see any while I was there. There are lots of restaurants/coffee shops within a block or two and their restaurant Ponzu is right next door. I've stayed at Kimpton Hotels 4 times now and the service is consistent across the chain. This hotel is on the lower end of the chain, but provides a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, good location, resto not so great”
Reviews.Author: GulabJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks along with several other colleagues Hotel is very near the main San Francisco shopping area (Market Street - Powell Street). It was being renovated when I stayed there but luckily didn't hear any construction noise. The hotel staff was very friendly. Several eating options are near the hotel like Thai, Japanese, Indian etc thankfully -- the hotel restaurant Ponzu didn't have too many options and was expensive. Note: DO NOT use the hotel room telephones for calling. The rates are really high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for the location”
Reviews.Author: bsosnowski
Reviews.Content: Visited SF on a pleasure trip and the location to the downtown is outstanding. The rooms are a bit small but sufficient. The daily wine tasting is a bonus feature and well enjoyed. Lots of things to do being so close to Union Square, Chinatown and the shopping. Easy to travel around as the BART, cable car and bus system are all minutes away. Found some very quaint resaurants with live jazz music nightly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLeah
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there several times and always feel well taken care of. This hotel is within walking distance of Union Square, the trolly lines, theatres - perfectly located. It's a combination of New York and Vancouver, BC to me! The beds are extremely comfortable as it's a boutique hotel. They provide Aveda toiletries and though the room we had was on the small side, it had everything we needed and then some! It is within about a two block border of a crummy part of San Francisco but it seems the trouble stayes away. It was a little tense driving through the surface streets the first time as you have to drive through that area a bit ,but it really disappeared a few blocks before we got to the hotel and there's nothing you'd want to see that would take you over there once you're checked in and on foot! Parking is expensive in this area but that's the bane of being in the center of San Francisco. I'll keep coming back here each time I visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value - And Nice Little Touches”
Reviews.Author: thegov
Reviews.Content: I usually try to stick with the big national chains like Starwood and ICH, but decided to venture out of my comfort zone and try the Serrano because the price was so great for San Fran. I cannot tell you how impressed I was with my stay. The location couldn't have been better. The people were all very friendly and nice, and the little details really were the cherry on top. Little things like: - Two complimentary items from the in room fridge. (because I joined the Kimpton program) - Free internet. This is HUGE to me!! - Free, VERY delicious coffee in the morning. - Free, iced tea, lemonade, and Arnold Palmers in the afternoon. - Aveda bath products. - Sauna down in the gym. Some of the things that would have made this stay flawless would have been: - Bathroom was a little small. This is a boutique and more historic hotel, so I understand the small bathroom, but about 50 more square feet would have been awesome. - Gym was a little small. They need like 2 more treadmills, because sometimes it got crowded in the morning. - The breakfast included in my package was just coffee, fruit, and a muffin. Would have been nice to see some eggs or something in there. I would DEFINITELY stay here again. They had some of the best rates in the area, great people, and a very comfortable, clean, and excellent room. Just a great value all around.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but average hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: TheSubmariner
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the hotel while visiting SF over the July 4th weekend. Pro was that it was walking distance from the BART station - we took the BART from the airport saving time and taxi money. We rented a car for the remainder of our trip (did the PCH drive over 4 days). Dont use their over-priced valet parking service (over $35!!), Instead use a parking garage a block or two near the rental car agencies - they charge only $15 for overnight. Hotel itself was quaint but the room was small! No breakfast included in the price - instead we ate at a nearby diner (Laura's diner - great!) Overall, the stay was pleasant - but I think I will stay somewhere else next time. Oh, they charged my CC an extra $3.60 for some reason... check your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel074
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel June 18 & 19. We were celebrating our anniversary. Prior to our arrival, I e-mailed and asked for a room on a higher floor. The staff accomodated this request with a nice room on the 17th floor. The room had plenty of space for us & our luggage. The bed is so comfy! The hotel is very clean and the staff is WONDERFUL! The bell staff are very helpful w/luggage or directions. The front desk staff also helped us with directions. Love the wine reception in the evenings and coffee and newspapers in the morning. The location is perfect to get to public trans or simply walking to Union Sq. Also great location to take BART from airport as the stop is about a block or 2 from the hotel (bets paying for a taxi). We did see homeless people and saw the "tenderloin" area but as any big city, one must always pay attention to surroundings and be aware. It certainly wouldn't deter me from staying again. If you are considering this hotel, you will not be disappointed. In fact, you won't be disappointed with any of the Kimpton Hotels. Join their "in touch" club, which is free to join...you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sthiya
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 Days while I was on a business trip/holiday. Overall the hotel is good but the room could be too small for some. The staff are really welcoming and helpful (some of them). The room is clean and it has a pretty good shower. They aslo offer free coffee in the moring which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfrankli
Reviews.Content: Very cute and the staff was extremely helpful. Is is being renovated right now, so i don't know if that is driving the low prices, but it was worth the money. The location is excellent, just 2 blocks from Union Square and all the activity. Beware of the cabs as this is close to the tenderloin district, the cabs are a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here during renovations (it's noisy!)”
Reviews.Author: TrellisB
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels, and would have been very happy with my stay had it not been for the noise from the renovation work. I booked a suite specifically so that I could use it to hold a business meeting on the second day of my stay (and yes, I explained that to the hotel staff when I made my booking) but when I arrived and found out how noisy the room was between the hours of 8:30am - 5pm I had to postpone the meeting and find a new location. Had I known how loud the renovation work would be I may still have stayed here (since I was at a conference or off-site at meetings most days) but I would not have spent the extra $50/day on a suite. I am very disappointed that the hotel staff did not advise me appropriately, and that I wasted both money and time on this business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near San Francisco Downtown”
Reviews.Author: C_Sutty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May - I agree that the rooms are a little compact - ours was advertised as a King Deluxe but wasn't roomy. Otherwise it was clean and tidy with a huge state-of-the-art HD-TV. The staff we met were friendly and helpful and helped us book tickets for Alcatraz the following day. Its handy for Downtown and whilst Tenderloin isn't a great area we never felt threatened when we walked through that way. There are many good restaurants, bars and diners nearby - we ate at the Sanraku Japanese restaurant one night which was excellent. A minor downside was the refurbishments that were being carried out meaning the building was covered in scaffolding - we had a room with big windows overlooking the main streets but these were filthy due to the work in progress. We got a good deal through Expedia which meant our stay was good value for money and I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Use of Space, Unique Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: sarahalta
Reviews.Content: I love the eco (green) bent of Kimpton hotels. My belief is that the hotel industry can be quite wasteful, so I appreciated the small room which was sufficient for comfort but not wasteful. I loved the unique atmosphere and the staff were helpful but not fake or intrusive. I always try to book Kimpton but have to wait for good deals. This was a great deal. In addition, the location was fantastic for exploring SF. We easily traveled to Golden Gate Park, the Fisherman's Wharf etc. from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlerkc
Reviews.Content: great hotel great location just blocks from powel street BART station

Reviews.Title: “Great base to have to go back to after a long day sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: SAUZER053
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 night stay at the Serrano.I can definetly recommend this boutique hotel for its friendly courteous staff and fine rooms.We were pleasantly suprised at the quality and quantity of the complimentary continental breakfast. The daily early morning trip down to the hotel lobby for free coffee was a great way to begin the day. I would especially like to mention the Manager (from the Ukraine) for helping us plan a trip to GG Park.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjackson0812
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical of boutique hotels coming in, and especially on a six day vacation was wondering how I was going to sleep. The Serrano did not disappoint! They put us in a suite on the very top floor, with a wonderful view of union square and downtown. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean and roomy. The only complaint I had was the bathtubs are made for sitting in, and it's tough to take a shower in those types of tubs. Also I wouldn't recommend venturing out west of the Hotel on O'Farrell, you are getting into the Tenderloin district which is pretty dicey. Stay east and in Union Square. All-in-all a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, reasonable location, overall decent experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Evaluator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing some sory of facelift on the exterior so you may have trouble finding it at first with the scaffolding. The lobby area and rooms are nice. Did not hear any extraneous noise in my room (nice and quiet), but then I did not face the street either. If you sign up for the free InTouch loyalty program they'll give you free wifi and other perks. It looked like they had a fitness center. The location is decent, a little farther out than places like the parc-55 and westin st francis, but still in a central and overall decent location. Staff is friendly and helpful. Of the five times or so times I called for things like room service or front desk support (wake up call, questions) I did not get someone on two of the tries. But when you do get someone they are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: jerrynmn1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Serrano Hotel. I spent 9 days at this wonderful hotel.The Staff consistently are all friendly, courteous, efficient ,and made me feel that they genuinely cared for my comfort. The rooms are of good size, clean, free wi-fi in every room, large flat screen TV, large comfortable beds, bathrooms are restocked daily with fresh towels, housekeeping Staff are thorough in cleaning rooms every day, and the Continental breakfast $1 extra package at the Ponzu Resaturant connected to the lobby, is convenient, food is great.There are many different package price offers that often change daily on the Serrano website, just check their website box, for "best rates".They have a modify your reservation and a cancellation policy of no penalty fee as long as you cancel/modify up to 24 hrs. before your reservation arrival date, in fact they don't even charge your credit card until the day you leave. Ask for a "pet free" room if you have no pets with you, and sometimes you can even get a room upgrade for no extra charge, if rooms are available.
